description: This course explores the arts and architecture of western Europe from c. 300 to c. 1300.  Through
lectures and discussions, students study paintings, sculpture, manuscripts, metalwork, and stained
glass windows created by the many cultures of this rich and diverse period in the history of art.
Students approach the material in a variety of ways; in addition to issues of style, technique, and
iconography, students address issues of viewing, patronage, and gender.  Offered periodically.
